content.p: The 2017 amendment, effective July 1, 2017, substituted "$150,000.00" for "$100,000.00" in the last sentence of paragraph (a)(3).
The 2020 amendment, effective July 1, 2020, rewrote paragraph (a)(3). See Editor's notes for applicability.

The 2021 amendment, effective July 1, 2021, added subsection (a); redesignated former subsection (a) as present subsection (b); substituted "public safety officer" for "law enforcement officer, firefighter, emergency medical technician, emergency management rescue specialist, state highway employee, or prison guard" in paragraphs (b)(1) and (b)(2); substituted "public safety officer" for "law enforcement officer, firefighter, emergency medical technician, emergency management specialist, state highway employee, or prison guard" in subparagraph (b)(3)(A); substituted "; or” for a period at the end of subparagraph (b)(3)(C); added paragraph (b)(4); redesignated former subsections (b) and (c) as present subsections (c) and (d), respectively; and substituted "public safety officer" for "law enforcement officer, firefighter, emergency medical technician, emergency management rescue specialist, prison guard, or state highway employee" in subsection (c).
